Car Rental

For those seeking to rent a car for either short or long-distance travel, the company specializes in providing tailored car rental services based on the customer's specific requirements.

Car Rental Configuration Business Flows Flow 1: Purchase (Buy) Flow 2: Rent a car Booking Pick-up  Return Flow 3: Renting Through Website Flow 4: Rental of 3rd Party Vehicle Sales Flow < CRM Purchase Flow


Configuration

Product Creation: Create a car in the fleet, update the necessary details and it will automatically create a rental product ( Through the studio, Automated Action- Create the product).
Product Configuration: Set time-based pricing.
Fleet Stages: Indicate the current status of the car (Stage update- Through Studio, Automated Action- Update Car Status When Booked, Update Stage When Picked Up, Update Car Status When Returned).
(Eg. The booked stage indicates that a booking has been received for the particular car)
License No.: On contact master to record driver's driving license (Through Studio).
Security Deposit: On rental order to cover any damages or extra charges (Through Studio ).

Business Flows

Flow 1: Purchase (Buy)

  • Create an RFQ for the product "Audi/A4/PAE234" by selecting the vendor, and send it by mail.
  • Set the ‚Äúcost price‚Äù that the vendor gave you.
  • Confirm the RFQ.
  • Validate the reception.
In case of lease create a contract.
To do that start with fleet:
- In fleet (Vehicle) create contract.
- Set the lease details.


Flow 2: Rent a car

Booking

To rent a car booking is mandatory, for that start with the rental:

  • Create a rental order quotation by selecting the pre-defined customer or creating a new one (Enter license no. also- Through Studio).
  • Add product, and enter details for the rental period.
  • Enter the security deposit amount (Through Studio).
  • Confirm the order. 
Note: If a child seat is required, it must be installed in the car's back seat. So, a child seat product needs to be added separately while booking the car.

Pick-up 

  • Proceed with pickup when the customer arrives for the key.

Return

  • check for any additional charges if any then add a line for charges.
  • In case of an early return change the rental period date (it calculates the amount accordingly).
  • Proceed with the return. 


Flow 3: Renting Through Website

  • Visit the website.
  • Search for available cars by selecting the rental duration.
  • Select the desired car and it will show the pricing strategy.
  • Add it to the cart and fill in your details to complete the booking.


Flow 4: Rental of 3rd Party Vehicle

In the case of car owners are your vendors.

To do that go to the products:

  • Create an "Airport pick up and drop" product. 
  • Define invoicing policy based on the timesheet.
  • Create a project with the same name as of product.
  • Set create on "task".
  • Set UoM as "KMS".

Sales Flow < CRM

  • Create a lead with customers' requirements (Manual or website).
  • Convert it into an opportunity and send the quotation for the product "Airport pick up and drop" by selecting the customer.
  • Confirming the quotation will create a task in the project "Airport Pick up and Drop".
  • Set Vendor in the task (Through Studio).
  • Set the "Out odometer" in the timesheet (Through the studio).
  • Once the trip is completed set the "In odometer" (Through Studio).
  • The system will automatically calculate the "total km" and update the sales order (Through Studio, Automated action- Update the hours).
  • Create invoice. 

Purchase Flow

  • Create an RFQ for the product "Airport pick up and drop" by selecting the vendor, and send it by mail.
  • Set the ‚Äúcost price‚Äù that the vendor gave you.
  • Select the task to keep a record of the vendor service (Through Studio).
  • Confirm the RFQ.
  • Once the trip is completed create a vendor bill.
